nl.fw.yapool

Class Pool<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.fw.yapool.Pool<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPool<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BoundPool

    public class Pool<T>
extends Object
implements IPool<T>
    A LIFO pool that can be used to re-use resources. The pool only keeps track of resources that are available for leasing (a.k.a. idle resources).
    Author:
    Fred

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected AtomicLong createdCount 
      protected Semaphore idle
      Manages permits for leasing resources.
      protected LinkedBlockingDeque<T> idleQueue
      A LIFO queue containing resources ready to be leased.
      protected org.slf4j.Logger log

    • Field Detail

      • log

        protected org.slf4j.Logger log

      • idle

        protected Semaphore idle
        Manages permits for leasing resources. Determines if permits are given in a fair manner or fast manner (see isFair().

      • idleQueue

        protected LinkedBlockingDeque<T> idleQueue
        A LIFO queue containing resources ready to be leased.

      • createdCount

        protected AtomicLong createdCount

    • Method Detail

      • create

        protected T create()

      • acquire

        public T acquire()
        Description copied from interface: IPool
        Acquires a resource from the pool within the maximum acquire time (default 0), unless the pool is closed (throws an IllegalStateException).
        Specified by:
        acquire in interface IPool<T>
        Returns:
        A resource for usage. This resource should be IPool.release(Object)d after usage.
        Throws a RuntimeException when no resource could be created.
        Throws a NoSuchElementException when no resource is available within the maximum acquire time.

      • acquire

        public T acquire(long acquireTimeOutMs)
        Description copied from interface: IPool
        Same as IPool.acquire() but uses the given acquireTimeOutMs as maximum acquire time.
        Specified by:
        acquire in interface IPool<T>
        Parameters:
        acquireTimeOutMs - acquire time in milliseconds. Any value smaller than 1 means "do not wait at all".

      • acquireIdle

        protected T acquireIdle(long acquireTimeOutMs)
        Parameters:
        acquireTimeOutMs - If the time is less than or equal to zero, the method will not wait at all.
        Returns:
        the idle resource from the pool, or null if none could be acquired

      • addIdle

        protected void addIdle(T t)
        Adds a resource to the head of the idle queue.

      • release

        public T release(T t)
        Description copied from interface: IPool
        Puts the resource back in the pool so that it can be re-used.
        Specified by:
        release in interface IPool<T>
        Parameters:
        t - The leased resource to put back into the pool.
        Returns:
        null if the resource was not put back in the pool.

      • setEvents

        public void setEvents(IPoolEvents events)
        Description copied from interface: IPool
        Sets the pool-event handler. By default, all pools have a pool-event handler PoolEvents already set. This method can be called even when the pool is open (i.e. in use).
        Specified by:
        setEvents in interface IPool<T>

      • getMaxAcquireTimeMs

        public long getMaxAcquireTimeMs()

      • setMaxAcquireTimeMs

        public void setMaxAcquireTimeMs(long maxAcquireTimeMs)

      • isFair

        public boolean isFair()
        If true, the thread waiting the longest for a resource will get the first available resource. If false, whichever thread is fastest to give the first avialable resource to will get the resource.

      • setFair

        public void setFair(boolean fair)
